author: Jacky Wong
title: Beware the Chinese Tech IPO Rush
text:
Chinese tech unicorns are stampeding toward the public markets: If the valuations touted by bankers are to be believed, companies worth an eye-popping half a trillion dollars are now planning initial public offerings this year. Investors should be wary of getting crushed.
The latest company to join the queue is Chinaâ€™s ride-hailing answer to Uber, Didi Chuxing, which could list with a market cap of $70 billion to $80 billion, according to people familiar with the situation. Other IPO candidates include Tencent Music, estimated...
